description: The Employment Subsidy Scheme, 2017, under the Goa State Incentives to Encourage Investments Scheme, 2017 (Umbrella Scheme), aims to boost local employment and attract investment.  Manufacturing industries (Micro, Small, Medium, and Large) in White, Green, and Orange categories are eligible. Hinterland Eco tourism projects in lesser developed talukas registered with Tourism, Goa-IPB, Town & Country Planning, PDA, or Eco Sensitive Zone Authority are also eligible. Key criteria include engaging a minimum of 60% Goan manpower (excluding relations defined under section 56 of the Income Tax Act), not availing benefits under CMRY, other employment schemes, or IT Department policies.  Subsidy is provided for up to seven years, calculated based on Goan manpower percentage (60-100%), with a maximum of Rs.25 lakh per annum for MSMEs and eco-tourism and Rs.50 lakh for large enterprises. Claims require documentation like registration proof, payroll, Goan employee details, audited balance sheets, GST returns, and certificates from Chartered Accountants.

procedures.step_description: Submit the claim as per the timeline in the Umbrella Scheme with the required documents.
Provide required documents such as registration proof, payroll, employee details, audited balance sheets, GST returns, and CA certificates.

funding_pattern: The subsidy will be calculated based on the percentage of Goan manpower employed, ranging from 60% to 100%.  For Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises and eco-tourism projects, the total wages paid to eligible Goan employees (up to Rs. 7,000 per employee per month) are considered, restricted to 50% for subsidy calculation.  Large enterprises follow a similar calculation but are restricted to 25% of total wages.  The total subsidy is capped at Rs. 25 lakh per annum for MSMEs and eco-tourism and Rs. 50 lakh per annum for large enterprises.

description: The Western Ghat Development Programme (WGDP) has been implemented in Goa since 1975-76 to develop ecologically fragile areas. It was modified and notified in 2016-17 and further amended in 2021-22.  The scheme focuses on soil and water conservation, creating employment, introducing new agricultural technologies, and encouraging the cultivation of medicinal, fruit, and forest trees.  It offers assistance for various activities, including training programs, maintenance of assets, production programs (planting materials, agro-processing units), and conservation programs (land development, trenches, gully control, bank stabilization, drain diversion, and dugout ponds).

procedures.step_description: Farmers/groups apply to the Zonal Agriculture Officer with the required application forms and documents.
The Zonal Agriculture Officer scrutinizes the proposal and submits it to the Horticulture Section for approval.
Technical sanction/evaluation is conducted by a Junior Engineer and countersigned by higher authorities.
Administrative approval is given by the Zonal Agriculture Officer or the Director of Agriculture.
Work is guided and supervised by the Zonal Agriculture Officer/Assistant Agriculture Officer and Junior Engineer, needing completion within six months.
Post-completion inspection is carried out, and reports are submitted.
Subsidy is disbursed by the concerned Zonal Agriculture Officer.
Monthly progress reports are sent to the Horticulture Section.

funding_pattern:
The funding pattern varies depending on the specific activity.  Some examples include:

*   Refreshments for promotional meetings: Up to Rs. 20/- per participant.
*   One-day farmer training program: Up to Rs. 200/- per participant.
*   Krishi Mahostav: Total expenditure of Rs. 1.25 Lakhs.
*   Maintenance of assets: 10% of the evaluated cost of the structure.
*   Planting materials: Up to Rs. 5000/ha.
*   Agro-processing and traditional art/craft units: Up to 50% of the standard cost, limited to Rs. 30,000/- per unit.
*   Land development: Up to 50% of standard unit cost based on land slope.
*   Crescent shaped trenches: Rs. 65/trench.
*   Gully plugging: 50% of actual cost.
*   Bank stabilization: Up to 50% of standard unit cost based on height.
*   Drain diversion: 50% of actual cost.
*   Dug out pond: 50% of actual cost, restricted to 15 sq m.
title: Western Ghat Development Programme (WGDP)

description: The scheme aims to assist individuals and groups in restoring and revitalizing ponds and tanks for irrigation purposes, thereby reviving village infrastructure and creating a microclimate conducive to better agriculture growth. It also aims to tap natural resources to supplement government efforts for increasing irrigation facilities and provide assistance during contingencies.

procedures.step_description: Individual/group applies to Zonal Agriculture Officer with application and documents.
Zonal Agriculture Officer inspects the site for feasibility.
Junior Engineer prepares estimates.
Zonal Agriculture Officer submits the proposal to Horticulture Section for Director's approval.
Horticulture Section scrutinizes, obtains technical sanction from Executive Engineer, and forwards for administrative approval.
Zonal Agriculture Officer conveys the approval to the applicant.
Beneficiary completes the work and informs the Zonal Agriculture Officer, submitting required documents.
Zonal Agriculture Officer inspects the completed work and submits documentation to Horticulture Section for evaluation.
Horticulture Section verifies and obtains evaluation from Soil Conservation Division, forwarding to District Agriculture Office for expenditure sanction.
Zonal Agriculture Officer disburses the subsidy.

title: Desilting and Re-vitalization of Ponds and Tanks
funding_pattern: 100% of the actual cost of the work, limited to Rs.70,000 per hectare of benefitted area. For groups, assistance is released in three installments of 25%, 25%, and 50%. NGOs or SHGs receive an additional 10% incentive for mobilization and supervision, released in two installments.

criteria.description: Applicant should ideally not be more than 55 years of age. In cases where the applicant is more than 55 years old, the age limit will be 58 years & the repayment schedule will be reduced.

description: To provide financial assistance to units engaged in construction projects (residential/commercial/residential cum commercial nature). funding_pattern:
The loan shall be secured as per the norms (not less than 100% immovable security cover) of the Corporation by first charge of the Corporation on the following security with clear marketable title:

Primary: The assets financed i.e. land, building & machinery, etc.

Additional/Collateral: Commercial or residential non-agricultural immovable properties or any other security acceptable to the Corporation on case-to-case basis, if required.

Personal Guarantee of the promoters/directors/a suitable person of sound financial means, etc. could be insisted in addition to the above wherever felt necessary by the Corporation.

The repayment history & past dealings of the promoters/unit/sister concerns/group concerns with the Corporation/Banks/FIs should have been satisfactory and the loan account classified as standard for past two consecutive years with bank/financial institution in case of takeover/repayment of loans.

The applicant should have a clear marketable title of the land and be agreeable to mortgage its immovable property as prime security and hypothecate its moveable assets with first charge to the Corporation or on pari-passu basis in case of consortium finance.

description: The District SPCAs of North and South Goa having their objectives for promotion of animal welfare and to protect animals from being subjected to unnecessary pain and suffering, are required to encourage the establishment of animal shelters, sanctuaries, water trough, and the likes for providing shelter and amenities to animals rescued from cruelty, incapacitated for work by reason of old age, sickness or injury. These animals are required to be given Veterinary Assistance with the help of Infirmaries and some of them may have to be rehabilitated at Animal Shelters.

procedures.step_description: The District SPCAs North and South Goa, shall apply to the Directorate of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services in advance of every Financial Year for Grant in aid as per the Form at Annexure “A”.

The Director AH&VS on due approval from the Government shall disburse the Grant in aid to the DSPCA in two yearly installments, through the Electronic Clearing System, for which these DSPCAs shall provide BANK Account details.

The Member Secretary DSPCA, will verify and certify the bills towards the cost of the components of the Grant in aid released in the first installment and submit an Utilization Certificate as required under the existing administrative, legal and financial regulations to the Director AH & VS.

On subsequent release of the second installment of Grant in aid from the Department of AH&VS, the DSPCA on utilization of the Grant in aid shall submit the final Utilization Certificate and Audited Report duly prepared by a qualified Chartered Accountant which shall be subject to audit by Statutory Auditors of the Government.

funding_pattern: Grant in aid
title: DSPCA – Animal Welfare & Rescue Scheme
department_name: Department of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services

description: The objective of this scheme is to ensure that the investigation, prosecution and trial of criminal offences is not prejudiced because witnesses are intimidated or frightened to give evidence without protection from violent or other criminal recrimination. It aims to promote law enforcement by facilitating the protection of persons who are involved directly or indirectly in providing assistance to criminal law enforcement agencies and overall administration of Justice. Witnesses need to be given the confidence to come forward to assist law enforcement and Judicial Authorities with full assurance of safety. It is aimed to identify series of measures that may be adopted to safeguard witnesses and their family members from intimidation and threats against their lives, reputation and property.

description: The Scheme for Education of Students with Special Needs is intended to provide a better educational environment for such children by providing them Individual Assistance and also by awarding financial grants to regular schools practicing inclusive education and special schools, as an incentive and for upgrading and enhancing educational facilities for students with special needs.  The Individual Assistance to students is meant to assist the families of such children and to remove any financial hardship to provide education that they face on account of the disability in their children. The Grant Component is meant for vocational training, counseling for parents and children, early detection and identification, intervention, formal and functional assessment by specialized agencies, building of necessary infrastructure in regular schools providing inclusive education and special schools, removal of architectural barriers, development of resource rooms, development of parent support groups, production and purchase of aids and appliances as well as teaching learning materials.

procedures.step_description: The scheme will be implemented through Regular Schools as well as Special Schools.

A Special School should have the strength of at least 20 children with special needs. Regular schools with academic skills resource room need a minimum strength of 10 students and life skills resource room needs a minimum strength of 5 children to begin.

The scheme will be implemented by the Directorate of Education, which shall consult the Directorate of Social Welfare/Goa Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education/Directorate of Art and Culture/Directorate of Sports, Directorate of Women and Child Development and any other concerned Government Department as and when required.

funding_pattern: Financial assistance shall be available under the first component of the scheme and given to children studying in Resource Room, Regular schools and Special Schools as per pattern of assistance.

description: To save the field/soil from erosion. To encourage the cultivation in fallow lands and to restore degraded cultivable lands. Conservation of soil and moisture in the upper reaches for cultivation of horticultural crops and other agronomical crops. To improve the economic viability of farming enterprises.

procedures.step_description: The interested farmers shall submit his application indicating approximate length and height of proposed retaining wall before commencement of work.

The farmer should also submit a photo before the commencement of work with at least one natural reference point in the photograph i.e. structure like wall, boundary stone, trees etc. to co-relate the site, while giving the administrative approval.
He should also produce the photograph after the completion of work with same reference point in the picture given above.

The Zonal Agriculture Officer (Z.A.O.)/District Agriculture Office (DAO) (North/South) would scrutinize the proposal on receipt of all the relevant documents and inspect the site and issue administrative approval accordingly. The farmer after completion of the structure in all respect shall report to the Z.A.O. and submit all relevant expenditure bills/vouchers to Z.A.O. for claiming assistance. The Z.A.O. will then inspect the claim and cases completed in all respect will be forwarded to District Agriculture Office for the settlement of claim.

description: Scheme to provide hired private buses to Government High Schools located in remote areas of Pernem, Satari, and Sanguem Talukas to transport students. The scheme intends to provide better transportation facilities to students in these areas where students come from far-off places, thus strengthening the educational infrastructure of the State. The Directorate of Education will hire private buses by registering them after advertising in three local dailies. Hire charges are Rs. 2400/- per day for a maximum of 80 kms, with additional mileage expenses borne by the Government. Buses less than 3 years old will be hired to transport children on school days (200+ days). Payments are made monthly based on certified bills through the school's Headmaster, endorsed by the PTA Chairman. The bus owner is responsible for children's safety and providing alternate vehicles in case of breakdowns. Violation of terms leads to termination.
funding_pattern: The hire charges for each bus will be Rs. 2400/- per day to cover maximum 80 kms per day. The expenses towards mileage beyond 80 kms per day will be borne by the Government.

description: Scheme for the rehabilitation of people displaced by the landslide that occurred on 14th June, 1999, at Tariwada in ward No. 3 of Mormugao Municipal Council.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: A person who lost his house in the land slide that occurred on 14th June, 1999, at Tariwada in ward No. 3 of Mormugao Municipal Council and who is in need of a shelter.

procedures.step_description: The Deputy Collector prepares a list of displaced persons within 30 days of receiving a request from the Board.
The list is published in three local newspapers, and displaced persons have 7 days to verify and submit representations.
The Deputy Collector finalizes the list and forwards it to the Board.
The Board allocates shelters to displaced persons by lot, based on the list.
The Member Secretary informs the displaced person of the allotment and calls upon them to accept the shelter.
If accepted, an order of grant is issued. If not, the person loses their right to rehabilitation under the scheme.
The Board considers the economic condition and other aspects of the displaced person when granting shelter.

funding_pattern: The cost of the shelter along with all other amenities shall be calculated and taken into consideration while fixing any rents required to be paid by the displaced person.

procedures.step_description: Application under the Scheme shall be addressed to the Secretary, Goa Labour Welfare Board.

funding_pattern: Government financed
title: SCHEME TO GRANT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO LAID OFF WORKMAN

criteria.description: Minimum period of 45 days lay off.
At least one year of continuous service as defined in the Industrial Disputes Act, 1947.
Age below 58 years.
Employed in an industrial establishment covered under Chapter V-A and V-B of the Industrial Disputes Act, 1947.
Not resigned or abandoned service on their own accord.
Have not enjoyed the benefits of Voluntary Retirement Scheme.

title: Retrenched Workers Assistance Scheme

description: Grant of financial assistance for purchase of text books/notebooks to school going children of industrial workers/employees.

procedures.step_description: Submit applications in the prescribed form through their employers or through the Heads of Educational Institutions where their children are studying.
The application should be duly signed and sent to the Secretary, Goa Labour Welfare Board.
The application should reach the Secretary on or before 30th September every year.

funding_pattern:
Class I: Rs. 1200.00
Class II: Rs. 1200.00
Class III: Rs. 1800.00
Class IV: Rs. 1800.00
title: GRANT OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FOR PURCHASE OF TEXT BOOKS / NOTE BOOKS TO SCHOOL GOING CHILDRED OF INDUSTRIAL WORKERS/ EMPLOYEES

criteria.description: Lowest income of the parents.
Preference will be given to the students studying in higher classes.
Workers having not more than two children will be given priority.

description: The Goa Labour Welfare Board provides monetary incentives to workers/employees or their spouses who undergo sterilization (vasectomy/tubectomy) to promote the small family norm.  The incentive is Rs. 4,000/- per person, in addition to any incentives from other agencies.  It is payable only once in the beneficiary's life.

procedures.step_description: Obtain a certificate from a recognized hospital's Medical Officer (Annexure A)
Complete the application form (Annexure B)
Get the statement regarding the number of living children countersigned by a Sarpanch, Mamlatdar, Gazetted Officer, or other notified authority
Submit the application and certificate to the Secretary or other designated officer at the Goa Labour Welfare Board within one year of the operation

funding_pattern: Rs. 4,000/- per beneficiary
title: Scheme for Payment of Extra Monetary Compensation for Sterilization to Employees

criteria.description: Two or less living children
Undergone vasectomy/tubectomy
Employed for more than six months

description: SCHEME FOR GRANT OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO THE INDUSTRIAL WORKERS /EMPLOYEE FOR PURCHASE OF SPACTACLES.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Industrial Workers/Employees who have completed one year of service in the Industrial Establishment

procedures.step_description: Get eyes tested in the State Hospitals or in the Goa Medical College or from a qualified Optician and obtain lens number.
Submit cash receipt for purchase of spectacles and prescription from the optician/doctor to the Secretary, Goa Labour Welfare Board.
Apply in the prescribed form for obtaining the spectacles or reimbursement.

funding_pattern: The cost of frame and lenses shall be borne by the Board to the extent of Rs.2000/-. If the cost exceeds the said amount, it will be met by the Industrial Worker/employee himself.
title: SCHEME FOR GRANT OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO THE INDUSTRIAL WORKERS /EMPLOYEE FOR PURCHASE OF SPACTACLES

criteria.description: Must have completed one year of service in the Industrial Establishment.
Must be covered under clause (C) of Section 2 of the Goa, Daman and Diu Labour Welfare Fund Act, 1986.

description: The scheme will procure and install sanitary pad dispensing machines with incinerators in industrial estates with a high concentration of female workers, and in schools/colleges for the workers' children. The management is responsible for maintaining the machines, and employers must replenish the machines regularly. The Goa Labour Welfare Board will cover the cost of installation and replenishment for schools/colleges and small industrial unit clusters.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Daughters of female industrial workers studying from class VII onwards

procedures.step_description: The management needs to provide a suitable place for installation, preferably a washroom.
The Goa Labour Welfare Board and the management will sign an MoU for installation, operation, and upkeep.
The management must maintain the machines in good working condition.
The employer shall periodically replenish the vending machine.
Non-compliance may lead to withdrawal of the machine or cost recovery by the Board.
Periodic visits by the Board will ensure smooth functioning.
A register of the amount collected and spent each month must be maintained.
Submit an application form with details of the establishment, number of beneficiaries, installation location, and agreement to the terms.

funding_pattern: The Goa Labour Welfare Board bears the cost of installation and replenishment of the dispensing machines installed in schools/colleges and in locations where it can benefit a cluster of small industrial units.  Employers will collect coins from the machine and use the money towards the purchase of sanitary pads.
title: Stri Sakhi Scheme

description: Excursion-cum-study Tours of the workers / employees engaged in the various Industrial establishments will provide an opportunity to visit various important Industrial, historical and religious places in the Country and broaden their out-look. For the above purpose, organizing excursions of groups of workers to various parts of the country will be useful. These excursions may bring workers of different places and different units together for exchange ideas to their mutual benefit. This will also help increasing the feeling of integration and oneness.

procedures.step_description: The management will submit the proposal to the Secretary through the subordinate officers concerned in the enclosed form ‘A’.
The Secretary in turn will examine the proposal and place the same before the Advisory Committee nominated by the Board for approval.
If recommended by the Advisory Committee, the Secretary will sanction the tour subject to the conditions laid down in the scheme.
On receipt of the sanction, the management should work out the itinerary of the tour with definite date of tour etc. and obtain prior approval of the Secretary before the tour is undertaken.
The Management will, in first instance, incur the expenditure and then claim reimbursement of admissible amount from the Secretary.

funding_pattern: 50% bus hire charges. The daily allowance paid to the workers during the period of tour will be Rs. 50/- (Rupees fifty only) per day per worker / employee. Emergent postal telegram and telephone charges incurred the trip shall be subject to a maximum of Rs. 200/- (Rupees two hundred only) per tour. Insurance cover in case of accident / death provided to worker / Employees during the tour, premium of which should not exceed Rs. 10/- (Rupees ten only) per workers / employees, with a nationalised Insurance Company.
title: SCHEME FOR EXCURSION-CUM STUDY TOURS FOR THE WORKERS/ EMPLOYEES EMPLOYED AT VARIOUS INDUSTRIAL ESTALISHMENTS

criteria.description: His / her name is in the wage register and has put in continuous service of at least two years.
He / she should actually be an employee of Industrial establishment on the relevant date tour and should be in possession of identity card.
His / her monthly earning should not exceed Rs. 2,600/- (Rupees Two Thousand Six Hundred Only) per month.
The workers / employees who have once availed themselves of the facilities under the scheme shall not be eligible for such benefit for the next 4 years from the date of completion of the tour.

title: Scheme For T.B. Domiciliary Treatment Of Employees Covered Under The Goa Labour Welfare Fund Act, 1986.

description: The scheme provides T.V. sets to industrial establishments, Labour Welfare Centres/Clubs/Recreation Rooms for the benefit of workers/employees. This allows them to view programs of national importance, promote national integration, and broaden their outlook.

procedures.step_description: Submit an application form in triplicate with details of the establishment, number of workers, existing facilities, type of TV set required, and other relevant information.
The management/union/government enters an agreement with the Welfare Board to maintain the T.V. set and exhibit programs daily.
The management provides suitable accommodation for the T.V. set.
Failure to comply with the scheme provisions allows the Goa Labour Welfare Board to withdraw the T.V. set or recover the grant amount with interest.

title: SCHEME FOR SUPPLY OF T.V SETS TO INDUSTRIAL ESTABLISHMENTS/ LABOUR WELFARE CENTRES/CLUBS/RECREATION ROOMS
funding_pattern: The Welfare Fund purchases coloured T.V. sets (cost not exceeding Rs. 25,000) or reimburses the full cost of Black and White T.V. sets (up to Rs. 12,000). Incidental expenses are borne by the management/union/club.

criteria.description: Minimum members of 300 workers for clubs, recreation rooms run by registered trade unions.
Applicants in labor concentrated areas will be given preference.

description: The scheme aims to provide recreational opportunities for industrial workers and employees and their families through sports, games, social, and cultural activities. These activities are intended to promote physical and mental well-being, improve human relations, and offer a break from monotonous work routines. The scheme can be implemented by the Secretary, management, or reputable social and cultural organizations. It can also involve worker/employee voluntary organizations like recreation clubs. Activities should align with the preferences of the workers/employees and their families in a particular area. Social activities may include celebrating national and regional festivals, and important national events. Functions will be held in areas with 1,000 or more industrial workers/employees. Expenditure can cover sports equipment, cultural activities (music, dance, drama, etc.), refreshments, prizes, arrangements, and social activities. Total expenditure should not exceed Rs. 20,000/- per year for an area with 10,000 or more workers, subject to budget limitations. Payments for events held by the Welfare Board require prior sanction, while events organized by management or voluntary organizations are eligible for 50% cost reimbursement up to Rs. 5,000/- after the event, with Board approval. Reimbursement claims must include details of the event, participant list, original bills, participant receipts, stamped receipt, and a detailed report.

procedures.step_description: Obtain sanction from the Goa Labour Welfare Board for events held by the board.

Submit reimbursement claims for events held by management or voluntary organizations, including details of the event, participant list, original bills, participant receipts, stamped receipt, and a detailed report.

funding_pattern: The total expenditure for the whole year for an area having a population of Industrial workers / employees of 10,000 or more should not exceed Rs. 20,000/- (Rupees twenty thousand only) subject to the limitations of budget provisions as approved by the Government of Goa and will be met from the Welfare Fund.
title: SCHEME FOR ORGANISING SPORTS GAMES SOCIAL AND CULTURAL ACTVITIES FOR INDUSTRIAL WORKERS / EMPLOYEES

description: SCHEME TO PAY INCENTIVES TO THE WARDS OF WORKERS ON THE BASIS OF PERCENTAGE OF MARKS OBTAINED BY THEM ON PASSING FINAL EXAMINATION CONDUCTED BY THE BOARDS/UNIVERSITIES FROM CLASS X ONWARDS.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Wards of workers/employees employed in the State of Goa

procedures.step_description: The eligible students should submit their application in the prescribed proforma to their respective Heads of Educational Institutions where they are studying along with attested copy of Marksheet and Certificate of employment from the management where their parents are employed.

After receipt of applications from the eligible students, the respective Heads of Educational Institutions shall forward all the applications along with the separate statement for each class-wise to this office within one month from the date of announcement of the results by the Board/Universities.

funding_pattern: Not specified
title: SCHEME TO PAY INCENTIVES TO THE WARDS OF WORKERS

criteria.description: Percentage of marks obtained by them on passing final examination conducted by the Boards/Universities from class X onwards.

description: Provides medical/monetary relief to the children of Industrial Workers covered under the Goa, Daman and Diu Labour Welfare Act, 1986. Assistance is provided for children who are mentally challenged or suffering from spasticity and are fully dependent upon parents/guardians for daily activities.

procedures.step_description: Submit an application in Form A through the employer, duly certified by competent medical authorities.
Submit the required certificates from the Institute of Psychiatry (for mentally challenged) or Orthopaedic Surgeon/Physician (for spasticity) annually.
Submit an Alive Certificate yearly.

title: SCHEME FOR TREATMENT OF MENTALLY CHALLENGED AND SPASTIC CHILDREN OF INDUSTRIAL WPRKERS
funding_pattern: Subsistence allowance @ Rs. 3000/- p.m. where the worker is the only earning member of the family and has no other source of income during the period of treatment.

criteria.description: A worker who has put in at least six months of continuous service irrespective of any pay limit.

The child should be certified as mentally challenged by the Institute of Psychiatry or certified with spasticity by the Orthopaedic Surgeon / Physician of Asilo Hospital, Mapusa / Goa Medical College, Panaji or Hospicio, Margao.

description: Scheme to provide financial assistance to female students studying in classes V and onwards. Assistance is based on school attendance, with a maximum of Rs. 2400/- per annum.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Female students studying in classes V and onwards, whose parents are workers/employees

procedures.step_description: Fill out application form (Annexure-1).
Get the application authenticated by the Head of the Institution.
Submit the application to the Secretary, Goa Labour Welfare Board by 30th September.

funding_pattern: ECS facility to parents' bank account.
title: SCHEME TO PROVIDE INCENTIVE / FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE ON THE ATTENDANCE IN SCHOOLS/COLLEGES ETC.. TO THE FEMALE STUDENTS STUDYING IN CLASSES V AND ONWARDS

criteria.description: Either of the parents of the student should be a worker/employee for at least six months.
The family income from all sources should not exceed Rs.20,000/- per month. Family income includes income of father, mother, and unmarried brothers/sisters.
Daughters of supervisory staff are not eligible.

description: Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme is a 100% Central Scheme covering the beneficiaries residing in rural areas and also from urban area comes under BPL category. Under this programme, pension of Rs.200/- per month to Senior Citizen and Rs.300/- per month to Disabled & Widow is provided to the beneficiaries of 60 years of age and above till the age of 79 years and thereafter Rs.500/-. The beneficiary must be a destitute in the sense of having little or no regular means of subsistence from his/her own source of income or through financial support from family members or other sources.
funding_pattern: 100% Central Scheme

description: The Beti Bachao Beti Padhao Scheme (BBBP) is a Central Sector Scheme implemented through State Governments/UTs to empower the girl child and enable her education. This scheme is intended to improve Child sex ratio across the country. This scheme seeks to address the issue of decline in child sex ratio across the country targeted at changing societal mindset and creating awareness. The scheme aims at preventing gender biased sex selective elimination, ensuring survival and protection of the girl child and ensuring education and participation of the girl child.
title: BETI BACHAO BETI PADHAO (BBBP)
funding_pattern: 100% financial assistance to the State Government/UTs. The Ministry of Women &Child Development will transfer the funds to the consolidated funds of the State Government after approval of the Action Plans (both state and district action plans) of the respective Government. The financial assistance is released in two installments; however the initial budget will be allocated as per the proposals received by the respective state.

description: The Griha Aadhar Scheme provides monthly financial assistance to housewives/homemakers from middle, lower middle, and poor sections of society to maintain a reasonable standard of living. The scheme offers Rs. 1500/- per month.

procedures.step_description: Submit application with required documents
Applications are scrutinized and sanctioned by the Director of Women and Child Development
Financial assistance is paid directly into the beneficiary's bank account via ABPS/ACH/NEFT
Beneficiary must submit a life certificate and income certificate annually

funding_pattern: Monthly disbursement

Not a beneficiary of the Dayanand Social Security Scheme (DSSS), unless a widow with a child under 18.

resident of Goa for the last fifteen years

description: The Laadli Laxmi Scheme aims to financially empower girls, helping with education and other expenses upon reaching adulthood, and improve the female sex ratio. Unmarried beneficiaries receive Rs. 1.00 lakh as financial assistance through a joint bank fixed deposit with the Director of Women and Child Development, renewed annually until claimed or age 45. Married beneficiaries receive Rs. 1.00 lakh in cash. In case of death before marriage, the amount goes to the government. In case of death after marriage but before claiming, it goes to parents or guardian.

procedures.step_description: Apply to the Director of Women and Child Development with required documents.
Applications are scrutinized and sanctioned chronologically.
Beneficiary opens a bank account.
For married beneficiaries, present personally for withdrawal order after submitting marriage certificate.

funding_pattern: Budgetary support.
title: Laadli Laxmi Scheme

criteria.description: Born in the State of Goa or resident of Goa for the last fifteen years and educated in Goa for a minimum period of 7 years (continuous), with at least one parent born in Goa and resident for the last fifteen years, or one parent residing in Goa for the last twenty five years. Parental income must not exceed Rs. 3.00 lakhs per annum.
In case of Tillari Irrigation Project affected persons rehabilitated in Goa, the 10/15 years domicile condition can be relaxed with a certificate from the Collector, North Goa District.

documents: 15 years Residence Certificate (or School Leaving Certificate and Bonafide Student Certificate)
Civil Marriage Registration Certificate (for married applicants)

description: The Bursary Scheme aims to provide financial assistance towards fees paid for various courses under higher and technical education in Goa. It intends to make higher education accessible to a wider range of students by reducing the financial burden.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Students pursuing College (Higher and Professional) Education in the State of Goa including post graduation
All the graduate and post graduate students, the annual income of both parent(s)/guardian taken together is less than Rupees three lakhs

procedures.step_description: Eligible students submit applications with required documents to the Head of the Institution within 15 days of the academic year's commencement.
The Head of the institution scrutinizes applications and submits a consolidated list to the Goa Education Development Corporation within 45 days of the course commencement.
Applications are placed before the committee for sanction within 30 days of receipt.
The amount is transferred to the student's account under the Direct Benefit Transfer pattern.

funding_pattern: The scheme is funded through interest on \"The Bursary Scheme Corpus Fund\" and annual budgetary provisions.
title: The Goa Financial Assistance towards fees for various courses under Higher and Technical Education Scheme, 2014 (Bursary Scheme)
documents: Std X and Std XII Passing Certificate and Marksheets
Graduation passing Certificate and Marksheets (for postgraduate students)
Proof of annual income (Form No. 16, Income Tax returns, or Income Certificate)
Proof of Admission to the course/programme and Bonafide student Certificate
Fee Receipts or Fee Structure certified by the Head of Institution

criteria.description: Students should have completed their Std Xth and XIIth and graduation (in case of post-graduation students) from an institution in Goa.
The requirement of a graduate degree from a college/university in Goa will be relaxed for degrees from Central University, NIIT, IIT, IIM, and other statutorily created institutions.
The institution where the student pursues their studies should be affiliated with Goa University and recognized by the Directorate of Higher Education/Directorate of Technical Education.
Students studying in Government of India institutions located in Goa conducting higher or technical education courses/programs who are eligible as per clause 3(4) will also be considered.
Students availing benefits under the Bursary scheme shall not be eligible to avail similar benefits under any other schemes of the Government of Goa.
The total course/program fees should not exceed 60,000/- per annum.

department_name: DIRECTORATE OF HIGHER EDUCATION, GOVERNMENT OF GOA

description: This scheme aims to provide counseling services to students in government and government-aided secondary and higher secondary schools to address emotional, psychological, and socio-economic challenges.  It covers various issues such as health, emotional and behavioral difficulties, study and learning problems, social difficulties at school and home, RSH issues, career issues, substance abuse, harassment, and violence.  The scheme includes workshops and awareness programs for students, teachers, and parents.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Students in Government and Government aided Secondary and Higher Secondary Institutions

funding_pattern: Government provides financial assistance for counselor and supervisor remuneration.
title: SCHEME FOR PROVIDING COUNSELING TO THE STUDENTS IN THE GOVERNMENT & GOVERNMENT AIDED INSTITUTIONS (SECONDARY/HIGHER SECONDARY)

description: The objective of this scheme is to support the efforts of the management of the Non-Government aided institutions/non-grant-in-aid institutions for up-gradation and maintenance of infrastructural facilities for promoting conducive atmosphere for learning.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: aided/ non aided institutions of higher learning including institutions providing professional Courses

procedures.step_description: The eligible institutions willing to avail the loan facility shall apply to the Directorate of Higher Education giving all the details as required under the scheme.
Every application should be supported by an approved plan of construction and the cost estimate of the project duly certified by a Registered Engineer and Chartered Accountant.
Every application should also be supported by latest audited statements of accounts of the institution.
All the applications shall necessarily accompany the documents of the sale deed/long lease deed or any other documents which indicates the ownership of the land where the building will stand.

funding_pattern: 50% of the loan amount shall be released immediately on the issue of sanction order by the Directorate of Higher Education. 40% of the loan amount shall be released on the production of a certificate from Government Registered Engineer duly signed by a Chartered Accountant (C.A.) and College Principal/Head of Institution; to the effect that the first installment of 50% has been fully utilized for the purpose for which it was granted. The balance 10% of the loan amount shall be released subject to the following:- (i) Production of the similar certificate as at (b) above to the effect that 40% of the loan amount has been fully utilized for the purpose for which it was granted. (ii) The project is completed and a completion certificate to that effect is produced by the Management. (iii) The occupancy certificate issued by a competent authority to the satisfaction of the Directorate of Higher Education.
title: SOFTLOAN SCHEME SCHEME FOR SOFT LOAN TO THE GRANT-IN-AID/ NON-GRANT IN AID INSTITUTIONS FOR MAINTENANCE AND UPGRADATION OF INFRASTRUCTURE FACILITIES.
documents: cost estimate of the project duly certified by a Registered Engineer and Chartered Accountant
latest audited statements of accounts of the institution
documents of the sale deed/long lease deed or any other documents which indicates the ownership of the land where the building will stand

criteria.description: The society which runs the institution should have been registered under the Societies Registration Act.
The institutions concerned should be affiliated to Goa University.
The institutions should have been recognized by AICTE/MCI/ACI/DCI or any other statutory body of the Government of India/Government of Goa.
The institution should have been in operation for at least 10 years, preceding the date of application of loan.
The institution should have minimum strength of 300 students on the campus.
The average passing percentage should not be below 60% in last three years out of five years immediately preceding the date of application for loan.

description: Revised scheme to provide loans to government-aided educational institutions in Goa for upkeep, maintenance, and upgrade of existing facilities. The loan can be used for construction/renovation of school buildings, toilets/bathrooms, hostels, playgrounds, and security equipment. It can also cover land costs (up to 50% of the total loan) for school buildings and playgrounds.  Items covered under non-salary grants are not eligible. Defaulted schools can apply if they clear outstanding dues with 10% interest.

procedures.step_description: Submit a proposal with required documents, including a resolution from the school managing committee, land title documents, approved plan, NOCs from Panchayat/Municipality and Health Department, undertaking on non-judicial stamp paper, cost estimate certified by a registered engineer/chartered accountant, and undertaking to utilize the loan for the intended purpose.
Proposals are scrutinized by a committee. The committee may consult GSIDC for technical assessment.
30% of the loan amount is released upon sanction. After utilization, submit a utilization certificate, progress report, and engineer's report.
GSIDC inspects the site and submits a report.
50% of the loan amount is released after verification of utilization and GSIDC's report.
Remaining 20% is released after full utilization of the previous installments and completion of the project.

funding_pattern: Loan-cum-Grant
title: Revised Infrastructure Loan cum Grant to Educational Institutions

criteria.description: Minimum enrolment of 160 students in Developed Talukas and 100 students in less Developed Talukas for Primary Schools.
Minimum enrolment of 300 students in Developed Talukas and 200 students in less Developed Talukas for Secondary Schools.
Minimum enrolment of 120 students in Developed Talukas and 80 students in less Developed Talukas for Higher Secondary Schools.
Minimum 70% passing percentage in SSCE results in Developed Talukas and 60% in less Developed Talukas.
The Educational Institutions should be at least 5 years old from the date of recognition.

description: The scheme aims to introduce yoga education in government primary schools to enhance students' overall development. It addresses issues like stress, lack of concentration, behavioral problems, and promotes a healthy lifestyle. The program involves training master resource persons who then train government primary teachers.  The scheme has been implemented in phases, starting with training teachers and then expanding to more schools each year.

procedures.step_description: Constitution of a state-level yoga cell of experts.
Identification and training of master resource persons by experts from Haridwar University.
Training of government primary teachers by the master resource persons.
Adoption of NCERT-approved syllabus and specially developed 'khel khel me yog' books.
Implementation of yoga education in phases, starting with a select number of schools and expanding gradually.

description: ST farmers are financially weak and do not use the required inputs as recommended for cultivation. It is proposed to provide assistance to the extent of 75% of the cost on inputs such as seed, planting material, pesticides, soil conditioners bio-fertilizer etc. with a maximum subsidy limit of Rs. 12000/ Ha. The quantity of the inputs will be ascertained based on area of crops cultivated and recommended dosage. The maximum area to be considered for subsidy for an individual farmer is 2.00 Ha. for one crop season limited to subsidy of Rs.24000/-

procedures.step_description: The scheme shall be implemented & monitored by Plant Protection Section under control of Dy. Director of Agriculture (PP).
The applicant farmer shall purchase the required inputs like seed, planting material, fertilizer & pesticide.
Farmer shall submit the claims to the Zonal Agriculture Officer with all the documents listed for attachment along with application.
The Zonal Agriculture Officer shall verify the case and recommend the subsidy as per the pattern of assistance to the Directorate.
The cases shall scrutinized by plant Protection Section at Directorate of Agriculture, and eligible cases shall be sanctioned for subsidy.
The subsidy shall be drawn and disbursed by Zonal Agriculture Officer, and paid by ECS.

funding_pattern: 75% of the cost on inputs with a maximum subsidy limit of Rs. 12000/ Ha. up to 2.00 Ha.
title: Assistance for Purchase of Agriculture Inputs
documents: Latest copy of the Form I and XIV of the land index.
Bill/original cash receipts towards purchase of inputs.
Copy of the Caste certificate issued by the competent authority.
Mandate form duly filled in for ECS transfer.
Form GAR 32 duly signed by the farmer

procedures.step_description: The eligible applicant shall apply for the award through the concerned Area Officer of the Department in prescribed format of application.
On verification of the content, the Area Officer shall recommend the same to the Director of AH & VS, Panaji-Goa for further necessary action.
On receipt of the application from the eligible applicant they will be scrutinized by the Task Force Committee constituted for the purpose by the Government.

After scrutiny of the application, the Committee shall visit the selected applicant and also at the related Dairy Co-operative Society/Bachat Gat/Self Help Group, for the necessary confirmation of the records.
The Task Force Committee, after complete scrutiny and confirmation of the information given by the applicant shall recommend the name of the Awardee for necessary approval by the Department.

description: The Goa Stray Cattle Management Scheme, 2013 (Modified) is designed to address the issue of stray cattle in Goa. The scheme aims to remove stray cattle from public areas humanely, transport them to designated cattle pounds, and provide them with proper care. The scheme encourages citizens to report stray cattle to local authorities, municipalities, panchayats, animal welfare organizations (AWOs), gaushalas, and civic and consumer forums (CCFs). The scheme outlines procedures for impounding, housing, and releasing stray cattle, including fines for owners who reclaim their animals. A Visiting Committee will oversee the implementation of the scheme and ensure compliance by AWOs, gaushalas, CCFs, and local bodies.

procedures.step_description: Citizens report stray cattle to local authorities.
Agency impounds and transports stray cattle to cattle pounds.
Cattle are housed, fed, and provided medical care.
Owners can reclaim cattle after paying a fine.
Unclaimed cattle may be auctioned to farmers for breeding/draught purposes.
Visiting Committee monitors scheme implementation.

title: The Goa Stray Cattle Management Scheme, 2013 (Modified)
funding_pattern: 90% government grant, 10% institutional funds (with possible 5% waiver based on merit and financial condition)

description: This scheme provides a subsidy of Rs. 100 per clay idol to registered artisans in Goa. The scheme aims to revive the traditional clay idol-making industry and support local artisans. description: Government desires to provide credit facilities to the farmers at subsidized rate of interest to accelerate investment in agriculture allied sectors in the State. Rate of interest applicable to the farmers will be 4% and the interest over and above this ceiling charged by the institutions shall be borne by the Government as interest subsidy to the farmer and will be directly released to the institutions.

Banks shall convey their decision to the farmer within 15 days of receipt of application.

description: Modified scheme for Custom Hiring Service in Agriculture. Objective is to promote agricultural mechanization, overcome shortage and high cost of manual labor. Encourage optimum tillage through custom service facility. Enable completion of agricultural operations in time. Bring in mechanization within reach of common farmer.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Department approved Farmers Club, NGO, Village Agro Service Centre
Department approved individuals hiring out machinery at approved rates

procedures.step_description: Farmers can hire machinery from Government Departments or Government approved agencies.
50% subsidy on standard hire charges will be provided to farmers at source while booking agriculture machineries on hire from Department of Agriculture.
For agencies, farmer has to pay full cost of hire charges and thereafter 50% subsidy shall be released to farmer after the work is completed and on due application.

60% subsidy for transplanting would be provided in case of collective farming for more than 04 Nos. of farmers having less than 1 hectare area of each individual farmers & combined to do transplanting collectively.
The subsidy for raising nursery & transplanting will be maximum of Rs. 15,000/- per hectare for individual farmers and Rs. 18,000/- per hectare for collective farming.

Agencies registered for providing custom hiring would be given the requisition for carrying out the work by the concerned Taluka Level officer against which the agency will carry out the work of the farmer.
In case of departmental tractors, subsidy to farmers will be provided at source while accepting advance payment towards standard hire charges.
In case of farmer, subsidy will be reimbursed to the farmer upon receipt of claim from farmer and after verification of work and receipts towards work done.
Farmer shall apply for subsidy within a period of three months from the date of execution of ploughing/harvesting/transplanting work.

description: The average area of cultivation under the Sugarcane crop in the State has remained static over the year so also the average production. It is important to improve the productivity and area under sugarcane crop so that the crop is more remunerative for farmers and also there is adequate supply of cane to the only sugar factory in co-operative sector in the State. This can be achieved by bringing new areas under the crop and by following Modified Sustainable Sugarcane Initiative (MSSI) techniques by the cultivators.

procedures.step_description: The farmers desirous of claiming assistance under the scheme shall apply to Zonal Agricultural Officer online in prescribed form along with scanned copy of certificate issued by Sanjivani Sahakari Sakhar Kharkhana Ltd., Goa, stating that he is registered grower with them and has brought ‘X’ M2 new area under sugarcane crop during the year by following MSSI guidelines.

Zonal Agricultural Officer shall verify the correctness of the claim/verification on site and determine the admissible amount of the assistance to the farmer as per the expenditure receipts/vouchers produced in support of the claim.
The claim thus received shall be uploaded for the scrutiny and sanction by the District Agriculture Officer, South/North-Goa.

funding_pattern: The farmers will get assistance @ Rs. 10,000/- per ha. towards the cost of land preparation and planting of single bud seedlings. The assistance will be 50% of the cost of expenditure on labour charges or Rs. 10,000/- per ha. whichever is less. The assistance will be provided to farmers on pro-rata-basis with minimum area of 2000 m2 per farmer.

description: One time assistance to farmers for removal of weeds/ shrubs/ bushes, aquatic weeds by hiring power driven machinery/ equipments/manually.

procedures.step_description: Interested farmer shall apply to the Zonal Agricultural officer (Z.A.O.) in whose jurisdiction the plough field is located.
He/she shall mention details of area to be cleared and type of machinery intended to be used.
The concerned Z.A.O. will inspect/field and accord administrative approval if the proposal is found feasible.

Upon receipt of administrative approval, the farmer shall get the clearing work executed by hiring machinery/equipment from any private/public sector agency, including labour and intimate the Z.A.O. regarding completion of the work and submit relevant payment vouchers/ invoices.
The cleared area should be used exclusively for cultivation of agricultural/horticultural crop.
The subsidy will be released only after verification and certification by Z.A.O. regarding satisfactory plantation of the Agricultural/Horticultural crop in the cleaned/cleared area.

The farmer shall submit an affidavit on stamp paper of value as specified from time to time stating that he/she would exclusively utilize the concerned field/plot to cultivate agricultural/horticultural crop and continue to do so for six years or more.

description: This scheme is introduced to provide financial assistance in the form of loan to the members of Scheduled Tribes for the purpose of repair, renovation/reconstruction of house.

procedures.step_description: The applicants need to fill up the prescribed loan application form complete in all respect along with 02 (Two) passport size photographs.

The prescribed loan application form shall only be accepted with all the required documents under the Scheme after proper scrutiny. Thereafter the list of eligible applicants will be prepared and physical verification / inspection will be carried out by the officer of the Corporation. The application form along with documents and inspection report will be placed before the sanctioning authority as specified below for appraisal and approval.

title: ASHRAYA ADHAR SCHEME
funding_pattern: Up to Rs. 5,00,000/- shall be advanced as financial assistance in the form of loan @ 2% per annum.

criteria.description: Any person belonging to Scheduled Tribe Community and having his house (which shall also include mundcarial house) either owned individually or jointly will be eligible for financial assistance under this scheme. In case the house is owned jointly and there are different units of the family in the same house residing separately, each such unit will be eligible for financial support under this scheme.

The age of the applicant should not be more than 55 years as on the date of loan application. However, the age of the applicant is relaxed up to 58 years in case the applicant is an employee of State/ Central Government/ Government Corporation/ Board or aided Institute.

documents: Age proof of applicant (Birth Certificate / School Leaving Certificate / Driving License)
Self Affidavit on Rs. 50/- Stamp Paper duly notarized
The copy of latest house tax receipt
N.O.C from Co-owner (if any) on Rs. 50/- Stamp Paper duly notarized

Income Proof of the applicant i.e. salary certificate/ Last 03 months Pay slips along with Form 16 or last 06 months Bank Statement. Incase applicant is self employed then Last 3 years I.T.R. along with last 06 months bank statement or income declaration cum affidavit on 50/- stamp paper duly notarized to be produced

02(Two) sureties with one passport photo of each surety, latest salary certificate or last three (03) months payslips along with last (06) months bank statement or Form 16 , affidavit of surety on Rs. 50/- Stamp Paper duly notarized and ID proof of surety. In case the applicant produces one surety working in the Government Department/ Corporation/ Board/Aided Institute then 2nd Surety not required. In case of applicant is the employee of State/ Central Government/ Government Corporation/ Board or aided Institute no surety is required
Estimated Cost of Repair/Renovation/Reconstruction of house (as per format)
Photos of the house to be repaired/renovated/reconstructed
Two passport size photos of applicant

description: The Goa Samagra Shiksha Abhiyan Scheme, introduced in 2018-19, integrates Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan (SSA), Rashtriya Madhyamik Shiksha Abhiyan (RMSA), and Teacher Education (TE) into a single Centrally Sponsored Scheme. Key objectives include improving learning outcomes, bridging social and gender gaps, ensuring equity and inclusion, promoting vocational education, supporting the RTE Act, and strengthening teacher training institutions.  The scheme prioritizes interventions in Educationally Backward Blocks (EBBs), LWEs, Special Focus Districts (SFDs), Border areas, and Aspirational districts, with a focus on teachers and technology to enhance learning outcomes. It offers flexibility to states in planning interventions and allocates funds based on objective criteria.  The integrated approach aims to improve transition rates, promote universal access to education, and strengthen teacher education through unified training and leveraging technology for wider access to quality education.
funding_pattern: 60:40 split between Centre and States
title: Goa Samagra Shiksha Abhiyan Scheme
department_name: Department of School Education, Ministry of Human Resource Development

description: The State Government as per the provision of Chapter 4 of section 10 of National Food Security Act, 2013 has formulated the guidelines for identification of eligible households to receive food grains at subsidized rates as per the provisions of the Act. In view of the above, following guidelines for identification of eligible households to receive food grains at subsidized prices as per section 10 of National Food Security Act, 2013 are hereby notified: I. What is National Food Security Act (NFSA).— An Act to provide for food and nutritional security in human life cycle approach, by ensuring access to adequate quantity of quality food at affordable prices to people to live a life with dignity and for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto. As per the Chapter 4 of NFSA, 2013 under section 10 as below requires guidelines to be formulated by the State Government. This following document puts in place the guidelines for identification of priority households for the State. Under Chapter 4 Identification of Eligible Households of NFSA, 2013 section 10 states that: “The State Government shall, within the number of persons determined under section 9 for the rural and urban areas, identify— (a) The households to be covered under the Antyodaya Anna Yojana to the extent specified under sub-section (I) of section 3, in accordance with the guidelines applicable to the scheme. (b) The remaining households as priority households to be covered under the Targeted Public Distribution System, in accordance with such guidelines as the State Government may specify”. II. Identification of Priority Household (PHH).— The households fulfilling the following eligibility criteria will be considered as eligible households for inclusion in the NFSA.
title: Guidelines for identification of eligible household to receive food grains at subsidized rates
funding_pattern: subsidized rates

description: A member of the Fund who has been working as a building worker for not less than one year after the commencement of these rules shall on completion of sixty years of age be eligible for pension. The pension will become payable from the first day of the succeeding month to the month in which he completes sixty years of age.

procedures.step_description: An application for pension shall be submitted in Form No. XX.XV to the Secretary of the Board or the officer authorized by him for the purpose.

If in the opinion of the Secretary of the Board or the officer authorized by him, the applicant is eligible for pension, he shall sanction pension and send the pension sanctioning order to the applicant. Provided that no application shall be rejected unless the applicant has been given an opportunity of being heard.
If it is found that the applicant is not eligible for pension, the application shall be rejected, and the applicant informed accordingly.

The applicant may file an appeal before the Board against the decision taken under sub-rule (3) within sixty days from the date of the receipt of the order. Provided that the Board may for sufficient reason in writing condone the delay upto one year in filing the appeal.

description: This scheme provides financial assistance to researchers and students in Goa for projects in science and technology. The grant covers equipment, travel, and other project-related expenses.  A Project Review Committee evaluates proposals, and grants are awarded up to Rs. 2,50,000/- per year, with a maximum of Rs. 3,00,000/- in special cases.  The scheme prioritizes promoting science and technology within the state.

Grant disbursement in two installments: 60% upon proposal approval and 40% upon submission of expenditure statement.

description: This scheme is introduced to provide financial assistance in the form of loan to the members of Scheduled Tribes for the purpose of repair, renovation/reconstruction of house.

procedures.step_description: The applicants need to fill up the prescribed loan application form complete in all respect along with 02 (Two) passport size photographs.

The prescribed loan application form shall only be accepted with all the required documents under the Scheme after proper scrutiny. Thereafter the list of eligible applicants will be prepared and physical verification / inspection will be carried out by the officer of the Corporation. The application form along with documents and inspection report will be placed before the sanctioning authority as specified below for appraisal and approval.

title: ASHRAYA ADHAR SCHEME

criteria.description: Any person belonging to Scheduled Tribe Community and having his house (which shall also include mundcarial house) either owned individually or jointly will be eligible for financial assistance under this scheme. In case the house is owned jointly and there are different units of the family in the same house residing separately, each such unit will be eligible for financial support under this scheme. EXPLANATION: Family means Husband, Wife, and Unmarried Children. The Father, Mother and unmarried brothers and sisters fully dependent and staying with the applicant shall also form part of the “family”.

The age of the applicant should not be more than 55 years as on the date of loan application. However, the age of the applicant is relaxed up to 58 years in case the applicant is an employee of State/ Central Government/ Government Corporation/ Board or aided Institute.

documents: Age proof of applicant (Birth Certificate / School Leaving Certificate / Driving License)
Self Affidavit on Rs. 50/- Stamp Paper duly notarized
The copy of latest house tax receipt
N.O.C from Co-owner (if any) on Rs. 50/- Stamp Paper duly notarized

Income Proof of the applicant i.e. salary certificate/ Last 03 months Pay slips along with Form 16 or last 06 months Bank Statement. Incase applicant is self employed then Last 3 years I.T.R. along with last 06 months bank statement or income declaration cum affidavit on 50/- stamp paper duly notarized to be produced

02(Two) sureties with one passport photo of each surety, latest salary certificate or last three (03) months payslips along with last (06) months bank statement or Form 16 , affidavit of surety on Rs. 50/- Stamp Paper duly notarized and ID proof of surety. In case the applicant produces one surety working in the Government Department/ Corporation/ Board/Aided Institute then 2nd Surety not required. In case of applicant is the employee of State/ Central Government/ Government Corporation/ Board or aided Institute no surety is required
Estimated Cost of Repair/Renovation/Reconstruction of house
Photos of the house to be repaired/renovated/reconstructed

description: The scheme is being implemented for active fishermen by providing insurance cover to the fishermen who are prone to accidents at sea due to rough weather and other natural calamities. The scheme is also offering life insurance cover for death of fishermen/crew due to any reason. This scheme shall be implemented as per pattern/rules approved by the Government of India/LIC from time to time. The annual premium payable is Rs. 330/- per annum per member to cover the eligible person in the scheme. The 50% premium of Rs. 165/- will be paid by the State Government every year and balance 50% will be borned by LIC. description: The scheme of Family Counselling Centre was introduced by CSWB in 1983. The Family Counselling Centres provide counselling, referral and rehabilitative services to women and children who are victims of atrocities, family maladjustments and social ostracism and also provide crisis intervention and trauma counselling in case of natural disasters. The Centres also create awareness and mobilize public opinion on social issues affecting status of women. The FCCs work in close collaboration with the local administration, police, courts, free legal aid cells, medical and psychiatric institutions, vocational training centres, short stay homes etc.

It should have facilities, resources, personnel, managerial skill and experience to initiate the scheme.

Its financial position should be sound and it should be in a position to raisesuch additional funds, as may be required, to complete the programme for which assistance is given by the Board and in addition, where necessary to continue to maintain the existing level of services from its own resources.
It should be open to all citizens of India without any discrimination on account of religion, race, caste, creed and languages.

description: The Goa Small Animal Rescue Management Scheme, 2014 aims to reduce the suffering of stray dogs through sterilization and vaccination against rabies, thus controlling their population and improving their welfare.

procedures.step_description: The Animal Welfare Organizations who have signed MoU with the Local Bodies shall apply for grants to the Director of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services through these local bodies, in whose jurisdiction the AWO intends to work.
The local bodies like the Corporation, Municipality or the Panchayats can also apply individually.
On verification of the contents of the application the Local Body shall recommend the same to the Directorate of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services through the local Officer of the Dept of AH&VS.

In case of grants for infrastructure, documents indicating the ownership of land or a copy of the lease deed document to be submitted along with the application. NOC from the Statutory authorities is essential to release the grants.

On approval from the Department of AH&VS the grants shall be disbursed to the local body through the Electronic Clearing System (ECS) for which these bodies shall have to provide their Bank details needed for ECS.

To avoid duplication of grants to the AWO from the Animal Welfare Board of India and under this Scheme, the local body shall deposit the grants in a separate account and disburse the same only within the components as specified under the Scheme and when required by the AWO.

The Commissioner of the Corporation / Chief Officer of the Municipality /Secretary of the Panchayat in whose jurisdiction the AWO works will verify and certify the bills towards the costs of the components as submitted in the application and submit an audited report along with Utilization Certificates as required under the existing administrative, legal and financial regulations.

funding_pattern: Grants up to 90% will be given to finance the cost of the vehicle. The salary of the driver cum animal catcher will be covered with 100% grants from this Scheme. 100% grants will be given towards the cost of the surgery, feeding of the animals and medication. 100% grants will also be given towards the payment of the monthly salary of the Veterinary surgeon. 100% grants will be provided for the structure and cages. 100% grants will be given towards the cost of feeding the dogs. The cost of the sterilization will include anesthesia, surgical material, medication and other requisites for which 100% grants shall be provided.
title: The Goa Small Animal Rescue Management Scheme, 2014

criteria.description: Municipal Corporations, Municipal Councils and Panchayats who have signed Memorandum of Understanding with the Animal Welfare Organizations with the Local Bodies.
The Animal Welfare Organizations should necessarily be registered in Goa and working in Goa for last 3 years.
International Animal Organizations authorized by the Animal welfare Board of India, may also apply.
Those Organizations who have applied for grants from the Animal welfare Board of India for the same components shall not be eligible for the same grants under this Scheme.

description: The Goa Stray Cattle Management Scheme, 2013 (Modified) aims to address the stray cattle menace in Goa by involving Municipalities, Panchayats, Animal Welfare Organizations (AWOs), Goshalas, and Civic & Consumer Forums (CCF). The scheme focuses on impounding stray cattle, providing them with proper care, and facilitating their release to owners upon payment of fines.  It also outlines procedures for handling unclaimed cattle and establishes a Visiting Committee to oversee the scheme's implementation.

procedures.step_description: AWOs, Goshalas, and CCFs apply for grants through local bodies.
Local bodies can also apply individually.
Applications are routed through the local body and recommended to the Directorate of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services.
Grants are disbursed to the local body through the Electronic Clearing System.
Local bodies deposit grants in a separate account and disburse them to AWOs, Goshalas, and CCFs as needed.
The Commissioner/Chief Officer/Secretary of the local body verifies and certifies bills and submits an audited report.
Stray cattle are impounded and transported to Cattle Pounds.
Owners can claim impounded cattle by proving ownership and paying fines.
Unclaimed cattle can be auctioned to farmers for breeding/draught purposes.

funding_pattern: The scheme offers financial assistance for various components, including vehicle purchase, driver salary, shed construction, cattle feeding, veterinary surgeon salary, attendant salary, rumenotomy cost, stray cattle survey, dead animal burial, and microchip/notching.  Specific grant amounts and limits are detailed in the scheme.
title: The Goa Stray Cattle Management Scheme, 2013 (Modified)

description: Government desires to provide credit facilities to the farmers at subsidised rate of interest to accelerate investment in agriculture and allied sectors in the State.

procedures.step_description: Farmers under Agriculture and Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services shall directly approach banks with requisite documentation.
Banks will sanction loans as per usual norms including approved scales of finance.

Applicants will apply through the nearest office of Directorate of Fisheries which will scrutinize the applications and forward them to the nearest bank branch as per preference indicated by the farmer within 15 days of receipt of application.

Every bank branch shall send their claim to the Director of Agriculture or Animal Husbandry or Fisheries as the case may be in the following tabular format, enclosed as Annexure duly consolidated for each bank branch, with office seal of the bank within one month after each quarter ending June, September, December and March.
The office of Director of Agriculture or Director of Animal Husbandry and Veterinary Services or Director of Fisheries as the case may be will scrutinize and approve the claims.
The bank branch-wise cheque will be issued by the respective Departments which will submit the details to the monitoring committee.

valid_upto: Initially for a period of three years and will be reviewed for continuation on completion of three years.

description: The Varah Palan Scheme provides financial assistance for the purchase and rearing of exotic/crossbred pigs to augment pork production and make the state self-sufficient. It also aims to provide subsidiary occupation to unemployed youth and motivate farmers to undertake scientific and intensive pig farming, upgrading the local stock for profitability.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Any farmer residing for a minimum of 5 years in the state.

procedures.step_description: Submit the application for purchase of pigglings to the Directorate of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services, Panaji through the respective Veterinary Officer/Assistant Director.
Enclose NOC from the respective Village Panchayat for setting up the Piggery unit with the application form.
Set up the Piggery unit with own finance or by taking a loan from any financing institution.
Purchase pigglings from the Government Piggery Farm, Curti Ponda Goa, or from a registered Pig Farm with NOC from the Government Piggery Farm and prior permission from the Director.
Set up the unit within 6 months from the date of sanction of the application.
Submit utilization certificate and required receipts to the respective Veterinary Officer/Assistant Director for subsidy release.
Execute an Agreement Bond stating that the unit shall not be closed for a minimum period of 5 years.
Vaccinate the pigs regularly as per the recommended vaccination schedule.

funding_pattern: Subsidy of 62.5% for males (max Rs. 9,000 each) and 74% for females (max Rs. 8,000 each) for piglets/adult pigs (max 20 females and 2 males). Subsidy of Rs. 2,000 per pig for shed construction. 75% subsidy (max Rs. 37,500) for Gobar gas unit (max cost Rs. 50,000). 75% subsidy (max Rs. 26,100) for other equipment (max cost Rs. 32,800).

description: The major constraint in the field of dairy development in the State of Goa is the lack of green fodder for the Milch animals. The nutritive value of feed and fodder has a significant bearing on productivity of livestock. In the present Scheme the subsidy is Rs. 65000/- per hectare, and provides irrigation assistance for perennial green fodder cultivation. Provision has been made for purchase of implements like water pump, PVC pipes, sprinklers etc with 75% subsidy on the total cost. Incentive for Perennial Fodder Cultivation per hectare area of land is Rs. 15,000/- for the first 6 months for the 1st and 2nd year, and Rs. 7,500/- for the first 6 months for the 3rd year. Incentive for irrigation is also given based on land area. In case of seasonal fodder, incentive will be given @ Rs. 15,000/- per hectare of land , per crop, with a minimum area of 500 sq. mt. Incentives for Hydroponic Green Fodder Production and Silage Production are also provided.

procedures.step_description: Apply in prescribed form to the Director of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services.
Show proposed land area to concerned Officer.
Minimum land area for cultivation is 500 sq. mt.
Provide Form I & XIV, notarized NOC from Landlord or Notarized Affidavit.
Minimum two fodder cuttings per year for perennial cultivation for 3 years.
Inspection of fodder cultivation every six months for perennial and each crop for seasonal.
Prepare land and cultivate within 2 months of approval.
Cut/harvest fodder at the beginning of flowering stage.

title: SCHEME FOR INCENTIVE TO GREEN FODDER CULTIVATION FOR PERENNIAL AND SEASONAL FODDER DEVELOPMENT IN THE STATE (Amended) 2017-18
funding_pattern: Subsidy of Rs. 65000/- per hectare for perennial green fodder cultivation. 75% subsidy on irrigation equipment. Rs. 15,000/- per hectare for seasonal fodder. 75% subsidy for Hydroponic Fodder Production units. 50% subsidy for Maize seed for Hydroponic Fodder Production. Rs. 2/per kg of silage production.

criteria.description: Minimum 5 Milch animals and 5 years residence in Goa for Hydroponic Fodder production and Silage making.
Land arrangement with required Form I & XIV and Affidavit.
Beneficiaries who have cultivated Green fodder under existing Departmental Scheme.
