description: The Pashupalan Scheme is designed to encourage crossbreeding of cows and buffaloes, rearing of cross-bred or improved calves (including indigenous breeds like Sahiwal, Gir, and Red Sindhi), and uplift the S.C, S.T. & Dhangar community. It aims to improve cattle and buffalo productivity through Artificial Insemination, financially assist farmers in stall-feeding and calf rearing, reduce stray cattle, and conserve indigenous breeds.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: All farmers availing the Artificial Insemination Facility for cattle and buffalo and registered with the local Government Veterinary Services
N.G.Os, Goshalas, Community Farms and other organizations availing the A.I. to cows & buffaloes.
All farmers irrespective of their financial status

All the farmers having cross-bred female calves/improved buffalo female calves/Indigenous breed calves namely Sahiwal, Gir & Red Sindhi, either born out of A.I. or calves born to existing cows and buffaloes or bought along with animals under Kamdhenu Scheme or Western Ghat Scheme or Modern Dairy Scheme/purchased locally under any other scheme of the Government

procedures.step_description: Register local cattle and buffaloes with the local Veterinary Dispensary or Veterinary Hospital.
Intimate the local Veterinary Centre when the animal exhibits oestrus for AI.
Keep the animal tied on the day of AI and two subsequent days.
Animals are microchipped in the third month after pregnancy confirmation.
Submit monthly progress reports for pregnant animals to receive feed incentives.
Register newborn calves immediately at the nearest Veterinary Dispensary/Hospital.
Ensure calves gain at least 30 kg per quarter to continue receiving benefits.
Submit quarterly weight gain certificates for calves to receive subsidy payments.

funding_pattern: The scheme offers incentives for AI, pregnancy confirmation, and calf rearing.  AI incentives are Rs. 500 for the first AI and Rs. 200 for the second.  Pregnant animals receive Rs. 2,000 per month from the 4th month onwards.  Calf rearing provides a 75% subsidy on estimated expenditure, with 100% for S.C./S.T. & Dhangar communities.  A birth incentive of Rs. 4,000 is given for female calves.
title: Pashupalan Scheme
department_name: Department of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services

description: The Government of Goa has an ambitious plan to develop the Dairy sector and to make Goa self sufficient in milk production in the near future. Dairy has a major role to play since milk has become an essential item of diet and with the increase of human population there is an increasing need for milk and milk products. Milk is a nutritious food that can also be converted into several Dairy products. Keeping this in view the Government has implemented a scheme wherein incentives are given based on milk produced so as to popularize Dairy Farming. This scheme is now further revised to accommodate growing demand of the farmers.

procedures.step_description: Every registered Dairy Co-operative Society/Bachat Gat/Self Help Group shall maintain a complete list of its members and allot a unique membership number to each farmer.
The beneficiary shall open a Bank account in any Bank having a core banking system/Electronic Clearing System (ECS).

The Dairy Co-operative Society/Bachat Gat/Self Help Group will submit to the area Veterinary Officer/Assistant Director in triplicate, a monthly consolidated report (Soft copy and hard copy), showing the total quantity of milk supplied by each farmer.
The Area Veterinary Officer/Assistant Director shall certify the statement received from the Dairy Co-operative Society/Bachat Gat/Self Help Group after verifying with registers maintained by them.
The local Area Veterinary Officer/Assistant Director shall forward the certified statement to the authorised agency for preparation of bill by 15th day of the month.
The authorised agency shall submit the prepared bills to the local Area Veterinary Officer/Assistant Director by 22nd day of the month.

On receipt of bill from the agency the local Area Veterinary Officer/Assistant Director shall verify & certify the same and forward it along with copy of the certified statement to the Directorate of Animal Husbandry & Veterinary Services by 25th day of the month for effecting payment.

funding_pattern: Composite subsidy @ 40% (incentive on milk @ 32.28% & cattle feed @ 7.72%) on the proceeds of milk supplied

description: The Government of Goa has designed this Scheme in order to honour the eminent personalities in the field of Dairy Farming. This Scheme intends to appreciate the achievement of Dairy Farmers for highest individual milk production by undertaking scientific dairy Farming in the State of Goa and encourage youth to take up Dairy Business.

procedures.step_description: The eligible applicant shall apply for the award through the concerned Area Officer of the Department in prescribed format of application.
On verification of the content, the Area Officer shall recommend the same to the Director of AH & VS, Panaji-Goa for further necessary action.
On receipt of the application from the eligible applicant they will be scrutinized by the Task Force Committee constituted for the purpose by the Government.

After scrutiny of the application, the Committee shall visit the selected applicant and also at the related Dairy Co-operative Society/ Bachat Gat/ Self Help Group, for the necessary confirmation of the records.
The Task Force Committee, after complete scrutiny and confirmation of the information given by the applicant shall recommended the name of the Awardee for necessary approval by the Department.

On approval from the Department of AH & VS the Gopal Ratna Award will be declared and conferred upon the selected beneficiary on Independence Day i.e. 15th August at the hands of Honourable Chief Minister of the State.

criteria.description: Extra ordinary contribution in the field of dairy farming by achieving highest milk production in the State.

Registered dairy farm with the department of Animal Husbandry and Veterinary Services.
Maintain and submit the record showing details of number of animals, stage of lactation of each animal, milk yield, date of calving, address of cattle shed etc.
Bonafide resident of Goa for at least preceding five years, own cattle shed with milch animals in the State of Goa.
Produce evidence of his membership from a registered Dairy Co-operative Society/Bachat Gat/Self Help Groups.
Produce and pour minimum 1 lakh litre of milk in the preceding year (April to March) with minimum average of 250 litre of milk per day, to the Dairy Co-operative Society/Bachat gat/ Self Help Group.

description: The Community Dairy Farming Scheme encourages larger dairy units with shared infrastructure to reduce production costs and increase milk production. description: To set up New Poultry Units of either 500 Broilers or 1000 Layers.

procedures.step_description: Approach the Government Veterinary /Doctor of the respective area for Application Form, which should be duly filled in and submit to the same Officer for onward transmission to the Director along with Officer’s recommendation.

The application will be scrutinized by the Directorate and then referred to the Financial Institutions indicated by the applicant. Loan is must and can be availed only from Bank and not Credit Societies.
The applicant has to arrange for the loan from the Bank.
After obtaining the loan the applicant can start with the cons after obtaining all the Licenses/N.O.C from, Gram Panchyat/Municipality and Health Department, or any other relevant authorities.
Once the project is completed an commissioned the utilization Certificate may be obtained from the Veterinary Officer and Bank Manager.

The Bank will then claim the subsidy from the Department by forwarding the application submitted by the beneficiary, together with purchase statement, purchase receipts, utilization certificate, Insurance documents, Agreement Bond duly signed by the beneficiary and two witnesses signed in presence of area Veterinary Doctor.
The beneficiary can purchase either 500 days old broilers or 1000 days layer chicks.
The subsidy will be released only on completion of the proposed poultry unit and submission of final utilization certificate from the Area Veterinary Doctor and Bank Manager.
The units are to be run for a minimum period of three (3) years.
The beneficiary should make his own arrangements to market the produce.

description: To assist the farmers to rear their cross-bred cows into healthy heifers within the prescribed time.

procedures.step_description: Register the birth of the cross-bred calf within 1 to 15 days of its birth.
Prepare a case paper for feeding the calf on concentrates starting after completion of 3 months of age.
Identify all calves by microchipping at the time of registration.
Produce a certificate giving details of Sire of which semen was used for A.I from the concerned Veterinary Doctor or the respective authority, if A.I. is done by any other Agency.
Produce a Xerox copy of ration card at the time of registration of the calf.

funding_pattern: 4 installments of feed on quarterly basis
title: Special Calf Rearing Scheme

criteria.description: The farmer must register the birth of the cross-bred calf within 1 to 15 days of its birth.
At 3 months the calf should weigh at least 60 kg.

The calves should attain weight gain of at least 40 kgs during every three months interval after registration for feed so as to be considered for the next feed quarter. In case there is weight gain less than 40 kgs, but above 25 kgs, a certificate may be issued by the area Veterinary Officer who may cite valid reasons for a lower weight gain.

The farmer at the time of registration of the Calf has to produce a certificate giving details of Sire of which semen was used for A.I from the concerned Veterinary Doctor or the respective authority, if A.I. is done by any other Agency.
The Farmer has to produce a Xerox copy of ration card at the time of registration of the calf.

description: The main reason for the success of the dairy programme in India is the involvement of milk producers in setting up their own organizations for milk production enhancement, milk procurement, processing and marketing. Thus progress in livestock sector is directly related to a more balanced development of rural economy and upliftment of the poor sections of the society. Special attention is being given to the farmers of this backward Talukas.

description: The Goa Rehabilitation Scheme, 2007, provides for the allotment of shelters to displaced persons who lost their houses in the landslide of June 14, 1999.  The scheme defines displaced persons, outlines the preparation of a list of displaced persons by the Deputy Collector, and details the allotment process by the Goa Rehabilitation Board. The scheme also considers the economic condition of displaced persons and allows for exemptions from rent in certain circumstances.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: A person who lost his house in the land slide that occurred on 14th June, 1999, at Tariwada in ward No. 3 of Mormugao Municipal Council and who is in need of a shelter

procedures.step_description: Preparation of a list of displaced persons by the Deputy Collector.
Publication of the list in local newspapers.
Verification of the list and submission of representations by displaced persons.
Finalization of the list by the Deputy Collector and forwarding to the Board.
Acceptance or modification of the list by the Board.
Allocation of shelters by the Board through a lottery system.
Intimation to displaced persons about the allotment and terms and conditions.
Acceptance of the shelter by the displaced person.
Issuance of an order of grant by the Member Secretary.
Taking possession of the shelter by the displaced person.

funding_pattern: Matching contribution from appropriate Government if the displaced person is getting assistance under the Dayanand Social Security Scheme or similar schemes.

description: The Government of India has introduced Prime Minister’s Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP) which is a credit linked subsidy programme to generate employment in rural as well as in urban areas of the State. The scheme shall be implemented in the rural areas by KVIC/KVIB and in the urban and rural areas by the District Industries centre. The scheme shall be monitored by the Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises, Government of India.

procedures.step_description: The Beneficiaries shall submit the proposal in the prescribed format along with other documents.
The proposals shall be placed before the District Level Taskforce constituted for scrutiny of the proposals. The Task force may call the applicants for interview on the stipulated day.
After the approval of the Task force, the proposals shall be forwarded to the Bank selected by the applicant. All public sector Banks are covered under PMEGP
The Bank shall appraise the proposals technically and economically and shall take its own credit decision after ensuring that the projects fulfill the criteria of the PMEGP.

After the project is sanctioned by the Bank, the beneficiary shall be deputed for EDP training at the designated EDP centers for undergoing training of two weeks. Those who have undergone such training through reputed training centers need not be deputed for the training.

description: Lokotsav (Folk Festival) provides a platform for artists to present folk songs, music, dance, and crafts.  Balotsav & Natyosav are children's and theatre festivals, respectively. Shigmotsav & Ganeshotsav showcase folk dances, songs, and cultural activities. Workshops are conducted on various art forms like Varli painting, Madhubani Painting, Block Printing, Batik Chicken Kari, and Bandhani.

procedures.step_description: For Lokotsav: Advertisement in local newspapers for stall/program applications. Scrutiny and allotment of stalls. Selection of performing artists. Exhibition and programs during the festival. Tender notice for pavilion setup. Pavilion tender awarded to the lowest bidder.
For Balotsav & Natyosav: Schedule planning and press release. Invitations to public and art lovers.
For Shigmotsav & Ganeshotsav: Local committees plan the schedule. Troupes invited. Invitations to public. Programs organized at relevant locations.
For Workshops: Schedule planning and press release. Invitations to public and art lovers.

description: The main objective is to create opportunity by which people from different parts of the country will get to know about one another’s culture and promote National Integration. Under this scheme every year cultural troupes are sent to other states and in turn troupes from other states are received in Goa.

procedures.step_description: After finalizing visit schedule in the conference of Sangeet Natak Academy the programme of visit is informed to groups and their willingness is invited.

The Cultural institutions and organizations working in training the artists and promoting the local talent having standing eminence have to submit their willingness for participation in programme to the directorate in stipulated time.
A committee set up in the department shall hold selection trials and the best performing groups are selected in order of merit and the groups are deputed turn by turn.
In case of exigencies reputed troupes are contacted directly for deputation.

criteria.description: Any Institution/Group willing to participate in the exchange programme should be preferably a recognized organization by the directorate.

The participants in the troupes should be as far as possible folk artists of the area and the number should not be more than fifteen in each case.
Each time groups i.e. male and female artists shall be considered for deputation.

description: The Kala Gaurav Puraskar scheme aims to recognize and felicitate artists above 60 years of age who have made substantial contributions to the field of Art and Culture, especially in Goa. The scheme acknowledges their lifetime achievements and provides a platform for appreciating their talent.

procedures.step_description: Department of Art and Culture releases a press advertisement inviting recommendations.
Department may directly write to institutions/individuals for recommendations.

description: The Government of Goa has designed this scheme in order to honour the young Goan individuals who have excelled in the field of Art & Culture in Goa. The scheme intends to give recognition to young artists par excellence for their outstanding achievement and for their extraordinary contribution to the field of Art & Culture.

procedures.step_description: Every year the Department of Art & Culture shall release a press advertisement thereby inviting recommendations of the names for Yuva Srujan Puraskar under this scheme from eminent institutions, individuals working in the field of Art & Culture.
The Department of Art & Culture may also write to any institutions, individuals from the field, to suggest/recommend the names for Yuva Srujan Puraskar, if required.

The committee constituted for the purpose of this scheme may also suo-moto take cognizance of outstanding achievement/contribution in the field of art of any individual artist and consider his/her name suo-moto.
Awardees shall be selected by the committee and not through self-recommendations.
Once recommendations are received from the Sub-Committee, the Director of Art & Culture shall obtain the acceptance of concerned artist to receive the Yuva Srujan Puraskar.

After obtaining such acceptance from the respective artist the Director of Art & Culture shall honour the artist by presenting Memento, certificate of appreciation and financial purse in the felicitation programme organized by the Department of Art & Culture after obtaining due approval of the Government.

funding_pattern: Rs. 25,000/- per individual.

criteria.description: An individual artist between the age of 25-40 years and who has given extraordinary contribution in the field of Art & Culture at large in his/her respective field of art in specific shall be eligible to receive Yuva Srujan Puraskar. Only in exceptional cases minimum & maximum age could be relaxed by upto 5 years.
To avail the benefit under this scheme, the Goan artist should have contributed in his/her respective field of art in Goa for minimum 5 years out of his/her career as a practicing artist.

No award will be presented posthumously under this scheme. However, during ion process if death of any artist occurs after recommendation of his name then Task Force Committee may consider his name for award, in such circumstances award will be presented posthumously.
No individual artist shall be eligible to avail the benefit of the scheme for a second time.

Every year maximum 6 persons in the field of Music/Dance, Drama/Tiatr, Folk Art, Photography/Painting, Craft, Sculpture, Bhajan/Kirtan, Literature, Film shall be considered for presenting the Yuva Srujan Puraskar under this scheme.

description: The Gomant Vibhushan Award is a scheme designed to honor and recognize Goan renowned personalities who have contributed distinguished and extraordinary achievements/services in any field of activities/disciplines at national & international level.

procedures.step_description: Recommendations are invited through advertisements in local newspapers.

A Selection Committee under the Chairmanship of Chief Minister of Goa considers the recommendations and may also suo-moto take cognizance of the life time achievement/contribution of eminent personalities.
The Director of Art & Culture obtains acceptance from the selected personality.
The Director of Art & Culture honours the personality by presenting Memento, certificate of appreciation and financial purse in a felicitation programme.

No award will be presented posthumously. However, during the process of selection if death of such artist occurs after recommendation of the name, then Task Force Committee may consider his name for “award”.

description: This scheme provides a subsidy of Rs.100 per clay idol (minimum 1ft height) to local artisans registered with GHRSSIDC.  The scheme aims to revive the traditional clay idol making industry and support local artisans facing competition from cheaper alternatives. The subsidy covers idols used for religious festivals and sold to the public, with a maximum of 250 idols per artisan per year.

procedures.step_description: Artisans submit applications in the prescribed proforma to GHRSSIDC.
GHRSSIDC scrutinizes applications and verifies production capacity.
Artisan submits undertaking that idols are produced locally.
Physical count of clay idols is undertaken in the presence of the artisan.
Artisans maintain records of idols produced and sold.

funding_pattern: 50% of the subsidy shall be released by the Government to the Corporation at the time of implementation of the scheme and the balance upon receipt of utilization certificate.
introduced_on: The Scheme shall deemed to have come into force with immediate effect.

description: The Goa Youth Rojgar Yojana Scheme aims to provide self-employment opportunities to residents of Goa. The scheme offers financial assistance for setting up various types of units/projects such as cashew processing units and vending kiosks. Eligibility criteria include age, domicile, and educational qualifications.  Financial assistance covers capital and working capital requirements, with subsidies available for kiosk costs. Repayment schedules and guarantee conditions are also outlined. An Appraisal Committee evaluates applications based on proximity to work, family income, qualifications, and an interview.
funding_pattern: Subsidy and Loan
title: Goa Youth Rojgar Yojana Scheme

description: The scheme provides seed capital to Self Help Groups (SHGs) for income generating enterprises under industries and services in the non-farm sector. SHGs receive a one-time non-recurring grant of 50% of the project cost (up to Rs.50,000/-) as seed capital. The remaining 45% is financed through loans from banks or financial institutions, with the SHG contributing the final 5% of the project cost.  The scheme aims to support the sustenance of SHGs, improve their financial strength, provide livelihood opportunities, and reduce rural-urban migration.

procedures.step_description: Joint application from SHG President and Secretary in prescribed format to Managing Director, GHRSSIDCL
Submission of Registration Certificate, EM Part I, list of members, details of activities, and project cost.
Deposit of 5% SHG contribution in bank.
Bank/EDC finances 45% of project cost after project approval.
Bank/EDC informs Director of Industries, Trade & Commerce of financing decision.
50% seed capital credited to SHG bank account.
SHG undertakes to recover loan from customers.

funding_pattern: 50% grant, 45% loan, 5% SHG contribution

However, expenditure towards the program will be borne by the Directorate of Official Language.

procedures.step_description: Applicant submits request letter with program details and expenses.
Request is scrutinized by Assistant Director and submitted to Head of Office/Department.
Head of Office sanctions up to Rs. 10,000/-, Head of Department up to Rs. 25,000/-, Administrative Secretary up to Rs. 50,000/-, and Government above Rs. 50,000/-.
After the program, applicant submits a report.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: citizen of India of Goan Origin

procedures.step_description: The Directorate of Official Language shall release an advertisement/Press note on local daily newspapers thereby inviting applications from Goan writers for availing benefits under the Scheme.
Entries must be sent in the “Application Form” given at Annexure, appended to the scheme alongwith three copies of the manuscript, for each entry.
A writer may send more than one entry for consideration, provided that their subject matter is different.
The entries must reach the Directorate of Official Language by post or delivered in person.
Entries received after the prescribed date will not be considered.

funding_pattern: Up to Rs. 1.00 lakh honorarium.

criteria.description: The manuscript should be on the subjects - Science & Technology, Sociology including Goan Ethos, Philosophy and Social Awareness, Human Development, Finance, History, Agriculture/Rural Development, Media/Mass Communication/Information Technology, Tourism, Administration etc.
Only unpublished manuscripts are acceptable.
The manuscript should be an analytical review of the subject it deals with. Manuscripts written in the form of novel, story, play etc. or text books written for schools, will not be considered.
The manuscript should contain minimum 250 typed pages (A4 size).
Manuscripts which have already received honorarium/award under any other Scheme, will not be considered under this Scheme.

documents: Passport size photograph of the writer.

Educational qualifications, which includes degree, awards, research and any other achievements in the field.

description: The Interest Subsidy Scheme, 2017, incentivizes units for making their enterprises financially viable by providing subsidies on term and working capital loans, primarily for manufacturing industries and Hinterland Eco tourism projects.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Micro, Small and Medium manufacturing industries listed under White category, Green category and Orange category
Hinterland Eco tourism projects in lesser developed talukas registered with/ recognized by the Department of Tourism/ Goa IPB/ Town & Country Planning/PDA/Eco Sensitive Zone Authority
Enterprises engaging a minimum of 60% of Goan manpower on regular employment

procedures.step_description: Submit claim after closure of financial year as per the timeline in the Umbrella Scheme.
Provide necessary documents along with the application form.
Delayed claims can be filed in the subsequent year, but lapsed claims will not be revived.
Unclaimed interest due to non-payment can be claimed in the subsequent year after payment.
For units with a consolidated balance sheet, a CA certificate providing unit-wise interest details is required.

funding_pattern: Subsidy on term loan interest: 30%, up to a ceiling. Subsidy on working capital loan interest: 1.5% of turnover or 30% of interest paid, whichever is less.  Pro-rata increase from 60% to 100% subsidy based on 60% to 80% Goan employment.
title: INTEREST SUBSIDY SCHEME, 2017
documents: Self-attested copy of registration under Umbrella Scheme
Certificate from nationalized banks/specified financial institutions regarding total interest paid
CA certified financial statements of the financial year

CA certificate certifying the amount of interest paid (with a break up of interest paid on Working capital loan and Term Loan) and the annual turnover of the claim year. The certificate should also indicate the extent to which the loan is defaulted (in case of default) and whether the loan is rescheduled.
Copy of payroll highlighting the number of total employees and Goan employees
CA certificate stating that no claim from the Department of Information Technology has been made for any incentives
For Hinterland Eco tourism applications, the certificate of registration/approval issued by the Department of Tourism/ CRZ Authority / IPB / Eco Sensitive Zone Authority
CA certificate certifying that no other claim for similar benefit has been made under any other scheme/program of Government of Goa

criteria.description: Commenced production after 01/10/2017

Availed loan (term loan and/or working capital loan) from any nationalized bank, scheduled private bank, Co-operative Bank, Economic Development Corporation Limited (EDC Ltd.) or any Non-Banking Financial Institutions recognized by the Reserve Bank of India.

Loans of EDC Ltd. covered under the Modified Interest Rebate Scheme 2012, interest paid under Chief Minister Rojgar Yojana (CMRY) Scheme or any other employment generation scheme of Government of India/Government of Goa, units under Goa State Financial Relief Scheme for Sick Industrial Units, 2016, or any such scheme as well as charges/overdue and penal interest are not eligible.
Enterprises which are taking or have taken any benefit under any policy of the Department of Information Technology, Government of Goa, shall not be eligible.
The scheme shall not be applicable to cases which have claimed similar benefit under any other scheme/program of Government of Goa.

description: The Goa IT Policy 2023 aims to transform Goa into a technology innovation hub, attracting high-end IT companies and fostering a thriving startup ecosystem. The policy offers various incentives for IT companies, including infrastructure development support, fiscal benefits, streamlined governance, and human capital development initiatives.  It focuses on key areas like IoT, Automation, Data Science, AI, Machine Learning, Robotics, 3D Printing, Software Products, VR/AR/MR, and Blockchain.  The policy also emphasizes skill development, industry-academia collaboration, and attracting Goan diaspora back to the state.
valid_upto: Five years from the date of notification in the official gazette.
funding_pattern: The policy outlines various financial incentives and subsidies for new and existing IT units, including rebates on land/built-up area purchases, lease rental subsidies, capital investment subsidies, stamp duty subsidies, power subsidies, internet subsidies, salary subsidies for freshers, patent filing reimbursements, quality certification reimbursements, and special incentives for smaller business units and Goan diaspora.

description: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY), also known as Housing for All (Urban) Mission, is a comprehensive housing scheme launched by the Central Government of India in 2015. The mission aims to provide affordable housing to all eligible families/ beneficiaries by 2022. Key features include slum rehabilitation, affordable housing through credit linked subsidy, affordable housing in partnership with public and private sectors, and subsidy for beneficiary-led individual house construction or enhancement.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: EWS households with an annual income upto Rs.3,00,000. States/UTs have the flexibility to redefine the annual income criteria as per local conditions in consultation with the Centre.

LIG households with an annual income between Rs.3,00,001 up to Rs.6,00,000. States/UTs have the flexibility to redefine the annual income criteria as per local conditions in consultation with the Centre.

sponsors.sponsor_type: Ministry of Housing & Urban Poverty Alleviation

funding_pattern: Centrally Sponsored Scheme (except for the credit linked subsidy component, which is a Central Sector Scheme)
title: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana

criteria.description: A beneficiary family comprises husband, wife and unmarried children.
The beneficiary family should not own a pucca house (an all-weather dwelling unit) either in his/her name or in the name of any member of his/her family in any part of India.
States/UTs, at their discretion, may decide a cut-off date on which beneficiaries need to be resident of that urban area for being eligible to take benefits under the scheme.

description: The Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana-National Urban Livelihoods Mission (DAY-NULM) is a poverty reduction program in India aimed at providing sustainable livelihoods to the urban poor. It focuses on social mobilization and institution development, capacity building and training, employment through skills training and placement, self-employment programs, support to urban street vendors, and shelter for the urban homeless. Key features include promoting self-help groups and their federations, providing financial inclusion, offering skill development and training linked to market demand, facilitating self-employment ventures and access to credit, creating permanent shelters for the homeless, and supporting urban street vendors through pro-vending urban planning, skill development, and access to credit. The mission emphasizes convergence with other government schemes, partnerships with private sectors, and community self-reliance.

procedures.step_description: Social Mobilization and Institution Development
Capacity Building and Training
Employment Through Skills Training and Placement
Self-Employment Programme
Support to Urban Street Vendors
Scheme of Shelter For Urban Homeless

sponsors.sponsor_type: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs

title: Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana-National Urban Livelihoods Mission (DAY-NULM)
funding_pattern: Shared between the Centre and the States/UTs

description: Elimination of open defecation in urban areas. Eradication of Manual Scavenging. Modern and Scientific Municipal Solid Waste Management. Aims to effect behavioral change regarding healthy sanitation practices. Generate awareness about sanitation and its linkage with public health. Capacity Augmentation for ULBs to create an enabling environment for private sector participation in Capex (capital expenditure) and Opex (operation and maintenance)
funding_pattern: The estimated cost of implementation of SBM (Urban) is Rs. 62,009 Crore. The Government of India share amounts to Rs. 14,623 Crore. States will contribute a minimum additional amount equivalent to 25% of GoI funding, amounting to Rs. 4,874 Crore. The balance will be generated through private sector participation, additional resources from State Government/ULB, beneficiary share, user charges, land leveraging, innovative revenue streams, Swachh Bharat Kosh, Corporate Social Responsibility, market borrowing and external assistance.
title: Swachh Bharat Mission - Urban

description: To encourage writers in the State to develop their talent and to give boost to Official Language. i. e. Konkani and Marathi.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Any citizen of India of Goan Origin

procedures.step_description: The Directorate of Official Language shall release an advertisement/Press note on local daily newspapers thereby inviting applications from Goan writers for availing benefits under the Scheme.
Entries must be sent in the “Application Form” given at Annexure, appended to the scheme alongwith three copies of the manuscript, for each entry.
A writer may send more than one entry for consideration, provided that their subject matter is different.
The entries must reach the Directorate of Official Language by post or delivered in person.
Entries received after the prescribed date will not be considered.

The application shall be accompanied with: Passport size photograph of the writer; Age proof; Residence proof; Declaration stating that the manuscript has not been awarded under any other Scheme; Educational qualifications, which includes degree, awards, research and any other achievements in the field.
An Evaluation Committee constituted by the Government will consider the entries.

funding_pattern: Under the Scheme a writer shall be eligible for honorarium maximum upto Rs. 1.00 lakh.\nNote: Above limit is the maximum limit and does not mean that the writer will get the honorarium upto the maximum limit. The Evaluation Committee shall scrutinize and decide upon the quantum of the honorarium.
title: Scheme for publications in Official Language

criteria.description: The manuscripts in Konkani or Marathi should be on the subjects - Science & Technology, Sociology including Goan Ethos, Philosophy and Social Awareness, Human Development, Finance, History, Agriculture/Rural Development, Media/ Mass Communication/Information Technology, Tourism, Administration etc.
Only unpublished manuscripts are acceptable.
The manuscript should be an analytical review of the subject it deals with. Manuscripts written in the form of novel, story, play etc. or text books written for schools, will not be considered.
The manuscript should contain minimum 250 typed pages (A4 size).
Manuscripts which have already received honorarium/award under any other Scheme, will not be considered under this Scheme.

department_name: Department of Official Language and Public Grievancies, Directorate of Official Language

description: To encourage farmer to go in for poultry production & increase poultry meat and egg production in the state.  25% of cost of Plant and Machinery will be granted as subsidy subject to maximum of Rs.2.00 lakhs to any individual for setting up Poultry Units.  The minimum unit size should be 2000 broilers (500 broilers per fortnight) or 5000 layers.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: individual having some experience in Poultry Keeping.

procedures.step_description: The beneficiary can start a Unit with his own finance or by availing loan from the Financial Institution.  In case the beneficiary avails loan from Financial Institution subsidy will be released through the concerned Financial Institution.

The Project Report of the proposed Unit is to be submitted to the Director of Animal Husbandry and Veterinary Services through the Area Veterinary Officer/Assistant Director alongwith the following documents.
The concerned Officer after inspecting the site will submit the application to the Directorate with his observations.
The Project Report/papers will be scrutinized and approval of the project will be sent to the applicant.
After completion of the Unit, the following documents are required to be submitted by the applicant for release of subsidy.
The Veterinary Officer/Assistant Director will submit all these documents alongwith completion certificate to the Director of Animal Husbandry.
The Dy. Director will inspect the Unit and submit his observations for sanctioning the subsidy by the Department.

funding_pattern: 25% of cost of Plant and Machinery will be granted as subsidy subject to maximum of Rs.2.00 lakhs
title: Financial Assistance for establishment of Modern Poultry Farm and purchase of Poultry Farm equipments
documents: Documents indicating ownership of land in Form I & XIV or copy of Lease Deed or N.O.C. from the Landlord in case of Tenants.
In case of lease the same should be for a minimum period of 10 years from the date of starting the Unit.
In case of Tenants NOC from the Landlord to run the unit for a minimum period of 10 years should be obtained from Panchayat/Municipality.
Purchase receipt of equipments, machinery and 1st batch of poultry birds.
Valuation certificate of shed and stores from approved valuer.

description: The main objective is to create opportunity by which people from different parts of the country will get to know about one another's culture and promote National Integration. Under this scheme every year cultural troupes are sent to other states and in turn troupes from other states are received in Goa.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Any Institution/Group willing to participate in the exchange programme

procedures.step_description: After finalizing visit schedule in the conference of Sangeet Natak Academy the programme of visit is informed to groups and their willingness is invited.

The Cultural institutions and organizations working in training the artists and promoting the local talent having standing eminence have to submit their willingness for participation in programme to the directorate in stipulated time.
A committee set up in the department shall hold selection trials and the best performing groups are selected in order of merit and the groups are deputed turn by turn.
In case of exigencies reputed troupes are contacted directly for deputation.

funding_pattern: Not specified
title: Inter State Exchange of Cultural Troupes

criteria.description: The items/programmes to be presented by the groups should be based on traditions and cultural heritage of the state.
The participants in the troupes should be as far as possible folk artists of the area and the number should not be more than fifteen in each case.
Each time groups i.e. male and female artists shall be considered for deputation.

description: The Gomant Vibhushan Award is given once in two years to honour and recognize Goan renowned personalities who have contributed distinguished and extraordinary achievements/services in any field of activities/disciplines at national & international level.

procedures.step_description: Recommendations are invited through advertisement in local newspapers.

Recommendations are accepted from sources like Chief Minister/Governor of Goa State, Ministers, Members of the Legislative Assembly, Members of Parliament, Government Departments of Goa and also private individuals, bodies etc.
The Selection Committee, chaired by the Chief Minister of Goa, considers the recommendations and may also suo-moto consider names.
The Director of Art & Culture obtains acceptance from the selected personality.

The Director of Art & Culture honours the personality by presenting Memento, certificate of appreciation and financial purse in a felicitation programme organized by the Department of Art & Culture after obtaining due approval of the Government.

title: Gomant Vibhushan Award
funding_pattern: Rs. 5,00,000/- (Rupees five lakhs only)

Persons of Goan origin, without distinction of race, occupation, position, age or sex.

description: The Government of Goa has designed this Scheme in order to provide financial support to high Schools in Goa to purchase Art Material required for the drawing/painting activity and programme prescribed for high school students. The Scheme supports high schools in their effort for promoting and developing art forms of drawing and painting in children. It also aims to improve the standards of teaching and learning art forms like drawing and painting in schools.  Any high school in Goa (Government/Non-Government aided/Non-Government un-aided) shall be eligible under this Scheme provided it is recognized by the Government. The high school should have at least one well qualified Art teacher employed on permanent basis. Drawing/painting should be one of the subjects and there should be substantial students having opted for the subject. Under this Scheme, high schools shall be given financial assistance to purchase art material required to improve upon the standards of the teaching and learning art forms i.e. drawing & painting prescribed in the syllabus. The high schools shall be eligible for financial assistance to the maximum extent of Rs. 5,000/- per high school per year. The grant may be utilized for the purchase of art material like colours, paints, papers, other stationery items etc. Every year a maximum of 50 new high schools i.e. maximum 25 high schools from North Goa and maximum 25 high schools from South Goa shall be selected under the Scheme.

procedures.step_description: Every year, the Directorate of Art and Culture shall suo-moto select not more than 50 high schools from Government, Non-Government aided and Non-Government un-aided high schools randomly, under the Scheme.
Application forms for the same shall be released to these high schools from the department.

The schools interested in availing benefit of the Scheme shall submit the forms within a stipulated time period with the following enclosures: Valid Government recognition certificate for the high school; Name and qualifications of the drawing teacher.

The high schools sanctioned grant under this Scheme shall strictly utilize the grant for the purpose it is sanctioned and shall produce the Utilization Certificate duly signed by the permanent drawing teacher, countersigned by the Headmaster/ Headmistress/ /Principal along with the seal of the school.

funding_pattern: Up to Rs. 5,000/- per high school per year.
scheme_link: Reg. No. GR/RNP/GOA/32 RNI No. GOAENG/2002/6410
title: Scheme to provide Financial Assistance to High Schools for purchasing Art Material

description: The Goa Scholars scheme promotes post-graduate studies by recognizing meritorious candidates with scholarships. It aims to invest in human capital building rather than project proposals.  The scheme offers up to twenty scholarships annually for postgraduate or doctoral studies in recognized institutions in India or abroad.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Students pursuing post-graduate (Masters or Doctoral) studies

procedures.step_description: Applications invited annually in prescribed format
Department announces scheme in media and website
Applications registered and assigned a number
Selection completed by August 31st
Shortlisted applicants interviewed
Applicants may need to provide additional details
False information leads to disqualification and repayment
Applicants write an essay on strengths, achievements, and vision

funding_pattern: Scholarship of Rs. 6.00 lakhs for studies in India or US$ 20,000 for studies abroad, disbursed in Indian Rupees.  Any other scholarships received do not affect this amount.
title: Goa Scholars Scheme

criteria.description: Age not exceeding 35 years
Resident of Goa for a minimum of 15 years or Goan origin with 5 years residence
Passed qualifying degree from a recognized institution
Minimum 60% marks in qualifying degree
Admitted to a reputed institution for post-graduate studies

department_name: Directorate of Higher Education, Government of Goa

description: The objective of the scheme is to promote pursuit of post-graduate studies by younger population of Goa, by way of recognizing the meritorious and outstanding candidates with a Scholarship to undertake Post-graduate (Masters or Doctoral) studies in Institutions of proven excellence, in India or abroad.

procedures.step_description: Applications under the scheme will be invited in a prescribed format every year, for the scholarships to be offered in that year.
The Department of Higher Education will announce the Scheme prominently in various local dailies as well as on the State Government/ Department’s website.

All applications received under the Scheme shall be registered and a registration number will be provided to the applicant. The registration number must be quoted in all the subsequent correspondence and documentation.

Procedure for selection of Goa Scholars under the scheme will generally be completed by 31st August every year. Shortlisted applicants, on scrutiny of the applications, will be required to appear for an interview (in person or on line) before the Selection Committee, and may be required to submit additional details regarding the Institution/Course, that they are to attend.
The applicants should write an essay of about 300 words on his/her strengths/personality/achievements and his/her vision for future.

title: Goa Scholarship Scheme for Post-Graduate Studies
funding_pattern: Scholarship

criteria.description: The age of the applicant for the scholarship shall not exceed 35 years on the date of application.

The applicant should be resident of Goa for a minimum period of 15 years. However the applicants who are of Goan origin (i.e. either of their parents or grandparents are born in Goa) and have a minimum residence of 5 years in Goa shall also be eligible to apply.

The applicant must have passed the qualifying degree examination from an institution preferably located in Goa. However, scholarships may also be offered to candidates who have passed qualifying degree examination from a well known and reputed institution located in other parts of India provided the candidate fulfills other conditions of eligibility.
The applicant must have scored minimum of sixty percent marks/equivalent grade in the qualifying degree examination.
The applicant must have obtained admission to a well known and reputed Institution in India or abroad for undertaking full time post-graduate studies.
